Description: Limestone bust of figure with round face, long hair hanging down front and back, hair patterned in Archaic manner by criss crossed lines at front, few vertical striations at the back. Two pierced holes of irregular shape at base, bored about halfway into the figure but not pierced through. Similar hole at the back, in the left part of the neck. Grainy whitish limestone (Egyptian?).
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ4 or Φ14? (?)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum, Glasgow. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Number '14' written in ink on the back. Pencil marking of Φ or 1 above a '4' in pencil. Possibly a context number.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CB.01) (Phase 3)
